IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine 2 transformers on our electricity poles to check they are functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place in the Reading Green area.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript:
This work is taking place on London Road.

To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we need to replace an overhead
transformer with an undergrounded transformer, whilst carrying this out we will be replacing the
overhead cables with underground cables. Once completed this will improve the reliability of the
electricity network in your area and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the
future.
Our engineers need to temporarily switch off your power so we can safely carry out the work.
Doing this will ensure our network is safe whilst works commence in the area.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: This is the planned power cut that was previously scheduled for the 21st of October 2025. We are needing to replace a piece of our electrical equipment due to it coming to the end of its serviceable life. This equipment is known as a linkbox and is essential equipment where our cables connect underground. To ensure our engineers can carry out these works safely we will need to temporarily switch off your power. Once work is completed this will ensure our electricity network is working to the best of its ability and also reduce the possibility of having an unplanned power cut. This work is taking place near Burntwood Lane. Temporary traffic lights will be in place to allow the works to be carried out safely.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified a pole that needs upgrading. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the poles. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our engineers may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. This work is taking place on Heath Road. A road closure will be in place to allow the work to be carried out safely. Access to your property will always be provided.

This work is taking place near Fambridge
Road. 
A customer has asked UK Power Networks to switch off the power so they can safely cut back
trees in the area that have grown close to overhead electricity cables. These trees could cause
damage to the cables and affect your electricity supply.
Our engineers need to temporarily switch off your power so a tree surgeon can safely cut the trees
away from 1 section of cables. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power
cut in the future.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 13:07 - Our staff have now managed to restore power back to the Lansdown Road area again.

They have thoroughly investigated our network equipment in the area, but the underlying network fault has not yet developed to a point for it to appear on any of their diagnostic tests. As such, they have replaced our substation equipment to restore power as quickly as possible.

I'm sorry this affected your power again today. This may happen again before we're able to pinpoint the issue and fix it, but if you'd like to talk to us about anything or if your power isn't on, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Stuart at 12:47 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, we appreciate how disruptive this must be for you, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Just to let you know our staff have now arrived back on site in the Lansdown Road area. They are going to test our equipment thoroughly to check if the underlying issue can be located before they attempt to restore your power again.

I know having power cuts this often must be causing you a lot of problems, and our staff are doing everything they can to keep the power on. Our time frame remains unchanged, and we're keeping in contact with our staff regularly to make sure you have the best information to plan ahead.

I'll update you as soon as we hear more from them. Sent by Stuart at 11:13.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 06:09 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers completed repairs to the overhead cables that were brought down by a fallen tree in the Pondtail Road area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. There are now only five properties without power, who we'll speak to directly as access will be required to internal equipment in order to restore supplies. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 07:05 - Our engineers have completed their investigations.

There's going to be a lot of work required to repair the issue safely, so we have decided to use temporary generators to provide power. To allow time for us to get the generators out to your area and connect them, we're now estimating we'll have power back on between 11:00 and 12:00.

We're sorry to change the time frame and will let you know when they arrive.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 07:02 - Thanks for your patience this morning.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our underground cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the KT16 9, GU21 4 area and are investigating the fault. You may find your power is going on and off; that is normal for this type of issue and is due to our engineers working to divert power remotely. By doing this, we've managed to restore power to 892 customers. There are now 116 properties still affected and using an average time frame we're estimating all power will be on between 07:30 and 08:30, but this may change later depending on what our staff find. IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: An underground electricity cable has faulted on our high voltage network, causing an area wide power cut.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Talie at 07:05 - Our engineers have completed their investigations.

There's going to be a lot of work required to repair the issue safely, so we have decided to use temporary generators to provide power. To allow time for us to get the generators out to your area and connect them, we're now estimating we'll have power back on between 11:00 and 12:00.

We're sorry to change the time frame and will let you know when they arrive.

Sent by Talie at 07:02 - Thanks for your patience this morning.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our underground cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Our engineers have arrived on site in the KT16 9, GU21 4 area and are investigating the fault.

You may find your power is going on and off; that is normal for this type of issue and is due to our engineers working to divert power remotely. By doing this, we've managed to restore power to 892 customers. There are now 116 properties still affected and using an average time frame we're estimating all power will be on between 07:30 and 08:30, but this may change later depending on what our staff find.

We'll keep sending SMS updates until everybody is restored. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Sent by Talie at 06:04.

Sent by Aaron at 19:30 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Church Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by unexpected trees in contact with overhead lines, which our engineers cut away.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. Steps.Message:
Hi, it's David from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I understand how difficult it can be without power and the additional worries this can bring.

For both our business customers and those at home, we will work as quickly and safely as possible to restore supplies. If you need any additional support or have any concerns, please call us on 105 or tweet us @ukpowernetworks.

I will personally continue to keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by David at 02:24

Sent by David at 23:03 - Hi David here again. Thank you for your patience while our engineers continue works on the underground network in the St Helens Court area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, this is David - I wanted to let you know I have just taken over for the night shift, so I'll be here until tomorrow morning making sure you have the latest news from our staff.

I know that power being off may be especially worrying for you as we head later into the evening, but our field teams work 24 hours so I'll let know further news as soon as it comes in.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 20:17 - We're pleased to report that all power in the Uckfield area should now be restored. Our engineers have now safely connected temporary generators and these will be providing your power while our engineers work to fully repair the unexpected high voltage fault.

Depending on what the issue is, it may take a few days for our engineers to plan in the work and make their repairs, but once this is completed safely the generators can be removed, and network power will be resumed.

If you'd like any further information, or if your power is not restored, please call us any time on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut today, our staff will work to restore your power as quickly and as safely as possible. A lot of our customers have questions regarding power cuts, and though you can always reach our team, you can also find some helpful information and answers to some of our most frequently asked questions on our website here - https://bit.ly/3pTfAz9 - Bear in mind this will use your mobile data, so feel free to speak to us if you'd prefer. We'll be in touch again once we have more information from our staff.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Luke at 17:54 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, we appreciate how disruptive this must be for you, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
